page.title: 10TOURISM IN ARNCLIFFE
page.content: Most tourists come in the summer time. The majority are day trippers, who park their cars round the village green and the church, because there is no official carpark in Arncliffe, nor are there any public toilets. There are three establishments where visitors can stay; the Falcon Inn, Amerdale House Hotel, and Raikes Cottage. These places also provide refreshments for day visitors, and there is one other house where light refreshments can be obtained. Apart from coming to enjoy the unspoilt beautiful countryside, tourists can find pleasure in the fishing, walking, picnicing, bird-watching and painting opportunities available in the Dale. Tourism is probably the second most important source of employment in the Dale, being surpassed only by farming.
